title: Introduction To Java
summary: Java is a general-purpose programming language that can be run on any device. Itâ€™s installed on billions of devices, is used by millions of businesses, and has a rich ecosystem of libraries and tools. Java has a strong network effect; the more people who use it, the more useful it becomes. Java also has a reputation for security; many organizations have strict rules about what languages and technologies they allow. The most common source of confusion is between Java and JavaScript; they are very different languages. Java is used to create apps and can be used to build everything from websites to robots.

It\u2019s installed on billions of devices, is used by millions of businesses, and has a rich ecosystem of libraries and tools. This means it has a strong network effect; the more people who use it, the more useful it becomes.
This network effect is particularly important given the rise of other languages like Python and JavaScript. While these languages are great, they don\u2019t have the installed base or maturity of Java.
This means if you want to solve business problems in the enterprise, you\u2019ll likely end up using Java.
Java also has a strong reputation for security. Many organizations have strict rules about what languages and technologies they allow. In these cases, Java is often the only option.`),mdx("h2",null,"A Short History of Java"),mdx("p",null,"The Java programming language is old, but it wasn\u2019t always called Java. In fact, it\u2019s been through three name changes. Here\u2019s a brief history of the language."),mdx("p",null,"In the late 80\u2019s, Sun Microsystems began a project to create an object-oriented language that could run on any device. That language was known as \u201COak\u201D and was designed to be portable."),mdx("p",null,"At the same time, another group at Sun was working on something called \u201CGreen\u201D. Green was designed to be secure, and a natural successor to C."),mdx("p",null,"Ultimately, Oak was abandoned and Green was renamed \u201CJava\u201D."),mdx("p",null,"The first version of the Java programming language was released in 1996 and became hugely popular."),mdx("p",null,"In 2006, a new version of the Java language was released. This version was designed to be simpler and more secure."),mdx("p",null,"As of 2019, the latest version of the Java programming language is version 9."),mdx("h2",null,"What Is Java?"),mdx("p",null,"Java is a general-purpose programming language that can be run on any device. It\u2019s used to create applications and can be used to build everything from websites to mobile apps to robots."),mdx("p",null,"At its core, Java is a set of concepts and rules for writing software. A programmer writes code that can be read and understood by a machine. The Java language is a way of writing this code using words and symbols that are easy for people to understand."),mdx("p",null,"When a programmer writes code in Java, a software called a \u201Ccompiler\u201D turns that code into something that computers can read and understand. Because a compiler turns the code into an executable, you can run your code and it will do something."),mdx("h2",null,"The Rise of Java: Good and Bad"),mdx("p",null,"The popularity of the Java programming language was initially driven by its portability. This was a big deal in the 90\u2019s when there were a lot of competing programming languages (C, C++, Perl, etc.). Many of these languages were \u201Cspecialized\u201D meaning they were designed to solve a specific computational problem."),mdx("p",null,`Java was different. It was designed to be \u201Cgeneral-purpose\u201D meaning it could be used to solve many different problems. This portability meant that programmers could create one application and run it on any device.
The simplicity and clarity of the language also made it easy to understand and allowed it to be adopted in a wide range of industries.`),mdx("p",null,"At the same time, the rise of the Java programming language was not without controversy. Many saw the language as a \u201Cbad thing\u201D. This was particularly true for people working in the C++ community."),mdx("h2",null,"Confusion About Java, Android and JavaScript"),mdx("p",null,`While Java remains an important and relevant programming language, it\u2019s also the source of some confusion.
The most common source of confusion is between Java and JavaScript. They are similar in that they are both programming languages that can be used on the web. However, they are very different languages.`),mdx("p",null,"Java is a general-purpose language that can be used to create anything, including websites. JavaScript, on the other hand, is a language that can only be used to write code for websites. You can\u2019t use JavaScript to create mobile apps or robots, for example."),mdx("p",null,"Java has been used to create Android apps since the very early days of the smartphone. Once again, though, there\u2019s some confusion here. The Android operating system is written in the Java programming language, but you can\u2019t use Java to create Android apps."),mdx("p",null,"Instead, you need to use a language called \u201CAndroid Development\u201D."),mdx("h2",null,"How to Learn Java?"),mdx("p",null,"Learning how to program can be challenging, but it\u2019s also a rewarding skill. To become a programmer, you need to understand how to think like a computer and how to express yourself in a language that a computer can understand."),mdx("p",null,`When you\u2019re first learning to program, it\u2019s important to focus on one language. Trying to learn multiple languages at the same time will slow your progress. You\u2019ll also confuse yourself and have difficulty remembering what you learned.
There are many good ways to learn to program in Java. You can find tutorials online or purchase a book. Popular websites like CodeCademy and Udemy also offer Java tutorials and courses.
This article is also a good place to start. It\u2019s intended as a beginner\u2019s guide to the Java programming language.`),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"The history of programming languages is a long and winding road. It\u2019s also one marked with failure and missed opportunities. That\u2019s because creating a new language is a challenging process. Creating a programming language that is easy to understand and has a network effect is not easy."),mdx("p",null,"Java has been around for a long time, but it\u2019s still a relevant and important language. There are many good reasons for this, but one of the most important is that it doesn\u2019t try to be everything to everyone. Instead, it\u2019s a general-purpose language that can solve many different computational problems. This makes it valuable, relevant, and influential."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

This makes JSF a framework that uses XML markup instead of code for building and rendering user interfaces.
A JavaServer Faces application basically is a collection of a views, managed by a controller, stored in an archive file and deployed on a servlet container. Such applications are known as \u201Cheavyweight\u201D because there are many different pieces involved to build it.
As we know, JavaServer Faces technology comes with several built-in tag libraries and default libraries such as standard action message, navigation rule, focus handler, and so on. Each library offers handlers or actions that enable you to use different components in your application. These components can be combined in any way you want to meet your specific requirements.
In this article we will go over what you need to get started creating a new JavaServer Faces application project in IntelliJ IDEA`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Learning to Code

It has become a highly sought after skill in recent years, with the demand for coders rising year on year. There are many reasons why learning to code could be beneficial for you as a career. The opportunities available to those who know how to code are considerably expanded.
Coding has become an essential skill in almost every industry, including marketing and sales, business analysis, data science, cyber security, artificial intelligence and robotics. Learning how to code opens up opportunities in almost any field because of its ever-expanding scope. As such, coding skills are becoming a necessity for anyone looking to work in digital or tech-related industries. Here are some benefits of learning to code that might help you decide if it\u2019s the right career path for you:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

They can also master complex code and find solutions to difficult technical problems. But beyond that, great coders bring something else to the table: they have a unique combination of traits that make them productive and effective programmers. The best coders have a set of common habits that allow them to thrive in an often stressful environment. There are many pressures on software engineers, from tight deadlines to the constant demand for new features. Great coders are able to thrive in this pressure-filled environment because of their ability to manage stress, focus intently, and think creatively about the problem at hand. If you want to become a great coder, these are some secrets you need to know\u2026"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Python - The Language for Database Programming

It can be used for almost any task, from small one-off projects to large frameworks for server-side development, web applications, and even mobile apps. One area in which Python excels is database programming. In this article, we explain why that\u2019s the case and explore the different ways in which you can use Python for database programming.
This blog post is part of our ongoing \u201CCoding in CV\u201D series. These shorter articles cover individual technical skills you may want to include in your resume or CV as a programmer or software developer - or indeed as anything with a computer in it! We look at everything from Java to cryptography and beyond.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

There are so many programming languages available in the market that it might seem confusing for programmers to select the one that best suits their needs and also caters to future needs.
Programming is not as simple as it seems, especially when you consider all the different aspects involved with it. It is not just about learning code, but also understanding which types of projects you want to take up and what kind of structure your career will take from here on. So when choosing a programming language, there are certain aspects you need to keep in mind before making your final decision. To help you out with this, we have outlined some of the main pros and cons associated with using Go for embedded programming in this article:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
